response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for ABC Code with pytest (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This document outlines various testing strategies using pytest for Python 3.12+ ABC (Abstract Base Classes).
key_points: Understand the basics of ABC and its implementation in Python 3.12+
Setup project structure with pytest configuration
Use pytest fixtures for setting up test environments
Write test cases for abstract methods
Utilize pytest plugins (e.g., Hypothesis, PyMock) for more robust testing

code_examples.code:
```
# pytest.ini configuration
[pytest]
addopts = --cov=my_package
[cov: my_package]*
branch = master,main
report = html
xmlfile = cov_report.xml
```

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for the usage of ABC.
pytest-3.0.x and newer versions are recommended.
caveats: Testing abstract methods directly might not be possible due to their abstract nature.
Utilizing pytest fixtures requires proper setup and teardown, ensuring isolation between test cases.
